alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 3:42PM CDT until further notice by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, DeWitt, Gonzales, Karnes and Lavaca. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 342 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cuero, Gonzales, Yoakum, Kenedy, Karnes City, Hallettsville, Yorktown, Shiner, Moulton, Runge, Smiley, Nordheim, Hochheim, Cheapside, Westhoff, Thomaston, Ezzell, Gillett, Sublime and Speaks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
